statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: UNLV 68, Colorado State 57
article.story: LAS VEGAS (AP) -- Louis Amundson had a game-high 21 points and 12 rebounds to lead UNLV past Colorado State 68-57 on Wednesday. Amundson shot 9-of-17 from the field along with two blocks. He had 15 points in the first half, going 7-of-12 from the field. Jo'Van Adams scored 20 points and eight steals to help UNLV (9-7, 3-1 MWC). For Colorado State (12-5, 1-3), Stuart Creason led with 13 points and five rebounds. Jason Smith and Andrew Patterson each scored 12 apiece. The Rebels led throughout the game except for two brief two-point Colorado State leads in the first half. UNLV jumped to a 16-7 lead before the Rams took their last lead at 21-19 with 8:31 left in the first half. The Rebels then responded with a 10-0 run and later led 38-29 at intermission. In the second half, the Rams never got closer than 58-50 with 3:12 left. UNLV then scored the game's next six points for its largest lead. Colorado State's Corey Lewis was ejected and whistled for an intentional foul after swinging toward Dustin Villepigue with 14:16 left in the game. Lewis left the game with four points in 12 minutes.
